TermDefinition.DefinitionText: A condition in which one side of the face is flushed, does not produce sweat, and has a constricted pupil and drooping eyelid. It can be caused by an injury to, or paralysis of, nerves in the neck, or by a tumor.

MediaLink.alt: Pronunciation of dictionary term "síndrome de Horner"

SpanishTermDefinition.DefinitionText: Afección por la que un lado de la cara se enrojece, no produce sudor, la pupila se achica y el párpado se cae. A veces la causa es un traumatismo o una parálisis de los nervios del cuello, o la presencia de un tumor.

RelatedInformation.RelatedExternalRef: Horner's syndrome (Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center)
